titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Moore Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday February 8, 2019 at 04:05
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Contains letters from Moore to various people, including Jacques-Emile Blanche, Edouard Dujardin, and Edmund Gosse; manuscripts of writings by Moore, including "Esther Waters", "Heloise and Abelard", "The Nineness in the Oneness", and "The Peacock's Feathers."

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The George Moore Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: George Moore Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to George Moore, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Series I, Letters from George Moore,
is housed in folders 1-38. Series II, Other Papers
, includes writings and a clipping. Series III, Additions Since July 1997
, contains material acquired after July 1997 and listed in accession order.

did.unittitle: 3 TLS to Mr. Bainton, 121 Ebury Street, London
ALS to [Jacques-Emile] Blanche, 4 Kings Bench Walk, Temple, [London]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Urges Blanche to visit Sir William
and Lady Eden in Paris.
Accompanied by ALS from Alfred F.
Goldsmith to Mrs. Bernard F. Gimbel,
1925 Jan 19.
Gift, 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Each letter is tipped to a sheet
containing an English translation.
In French.
Gift, 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Each letter is tipped to a sheet
containing an English translation.
In French.
Gift, 1958.

ALS to Stephen Gooden, 121 Ebury Street

The Bowling Green Press, London:
Faber & Gwyer, ltd., 1927).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

did.unittitle: ALS to "Dear Princess" [Amelie Rives Troubetskoy]; 92 Victoria Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Thanking her for a letter and
promising to read "Virginia
of Virginia."

did.unittitle: TLS, corrected, to "Dear Sir" [Barrett Harper Clark]; 121 Ebury Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Concerning Clark's "Contemporary
French Dramatists" and the postal
service.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Bound with reprint from the English
Review of "Euphorion in Texas,"
1914 Jul; and a reproduction of a
lithographed portrait of Moore by
Miss Harrison.
Bookplate: John A. Spoor.
Binding: three-quarter green
morocco, by Riviere.
Purchased in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Galley proofs of the first edition,
cut and mounted on blank leaves, and
bound.
Inscribed to Mary Hunter from GM, 1927.
Bookplate: Mary Hunter.
Purchased in 2002.

did.unittitle: ALS to [Lena Margaret] Ashwell; 4, Upper Ely Place, Dublin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Inviting her to lunch and mentioning
his new comedy.
Purchased in 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Second and third page proofs,
corrected and revised.
Signed and dated: "George Moore,
May, 1918."
Ex libris B. George Ulizio.
Ex libris Donald Stralem.
Purchased in 2004.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mr. Smith, 121 Ebury Street

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Enclosing galley proofs, corrected,
for "The Nineness in the Oneness."
Gift.
